title: Technology Vendor Manager (Mainframe, Power BI)
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
How will you make an impact in this role?
Technology Vendor Manager for the Vendor Charge Management Team within AET Vendor and Business Management Organization. Primary role will be to lead the validation of Kyndryl invoicing for Mainframe 3rd Party Software, manage a significant amount of data, continue creating efficiencies and automation of processes, support operational mapping of Mainframe cost components, ad-hoc projects and product reporting.
Responsibilities:
Serve as the lead for the financial analysis and reporting of Mainframe third party software.
Validate billing of various software vendors, engage in approval process of new software, evaluate cost impact of capacity increases, and participate in action based save projects.
Manage complex data utilizing SQL, sourcing information from multiple sources including mainframe databases and providing output to a variety of customers.
Maintain mapping tables currently in Access by working with peers and across multiple organizations. 
Implement a new data warehouse self-serve tool for customers to obtain financial Mainframe data in support of cost saves and reengineering opportunities.
Identify new opportunities for managing operational mapping, improve SQL processes and increase data processes efficiencies.
Works with the Finance & TCAI to ensure alignment of actuals, baselines, forecasts, and projection data across organizations.
Support the annual baseline forecast for Kyndryl invoice related to Mainframe Consumption
Provide support as needed towards other Mainframe ad-hoc inquiries, invoice validation and reporting processes.
Ability to present complex financial analysis and ratios to senior leadership
Works with contract labor partners to do rate card analysis and invoice reconciliation when required
 As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
Minimum Qualifications
Advanced experience with Power BI, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and SQL experience required
Ability to manage a significant volume of complex data
Strong collaboration skills in working as a team of 3 to support the Mainframe billing tower within SCM and across multiple organizations supporting Mainframe.
Requires strong analytical skills, financial acumen and reporting
Proven collaboration skills along with the ability to influence without authority
Ability to be assertive and challenge the status quo, while still maintaining strong and effective relationships
Ability to communicate with multiple levels of leadership.
Ability to use business and technical experience to identify impacts or risks and create plans to mitigate them
Proven ability to effectively manage multiple competing priorities, including planning, management and execution of responsibilities
Holds a Bachelor's Degree or Masters in Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field or has the equivalent work experience
Experience working directly with third-party vendors or other vendor management preferred
Salary Range: $110,000.00 to $190,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. title: Senior Engineer - Full Stack
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
You will be leading of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class Omnichannel payment experiences and personal integration through REST on vert.x polyglot event-driven application framework and data driven solution on Big Data stack, Machine Learning and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative and transformative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.
We are looking for passionate Digital / Web Senior engineer to work and lead team on the futuristic web engineering, Digital asset creation & API integration for our clients & partners. This requires the ability to go deep in the American Express payment system with many dependencies while responsible for the technical deliveries and implementation of components. As a Senior engineer in our OPEN SOURCE development team you will be responsible for lead, develop and deliver digital experience for the future supporting AMEX user experiences on Omnichannel (web, bot,mobile, etc.), as well as integrations with partners. Strong on Cloud technology implementation private and public / hybrid domains. Senior Engineer lead POCs, MVP using open source , American express frameworks like OneAmex , Cloud Event schema for event architecture.
You will work closely with product and experience to understand the requirements and deliver product that meets these requirements. Technologies used vary from Java, Spring, REST, REACT, Angular, SPRING, Node.js, SPARK, SCALA, HIVE , Python etc. If you are the kind of lead engineer who is passionate about bringing great products to life especially in payment area, being a crafts(wo)man in engineering and love working in a collaborative environment with your product partners and dependency teams, then we want to talk to you.
Responsibilities:
Perform all technical aspects of software development for assigned applications including design, hands-on engineering, developing framework & tooling including prototypes, and code review, mentor engineering peers and own and drive transformation with various technology domains.
Experience designing and developing REST APIs for high volume clients.
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL, MongoDb, Couchbase, or Cassandra is a plus.
Function as a engineering leader on an agile team to build scalable software solutions through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation).
Lead code reviews (Pull Requests)
Lead and contribute into engineering excellence like automated of all testing areas.
Lead Product Management and work closely with product owners in defining product and engineering roadmap.
Debug software components and identify code defects for remediation.
Leads the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments.
Automate deployments in test or production environments.
Goal to have all applications able automatically scale and non functional requirements of self-healing built within every critical journeys
Strong interpersonal leadership
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals.
Influence team members with innovative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking.
Be a productivity multiplier for your team by analyzing your workflow and contributing to enable the team to be more effective, productive, and demonstrating faster and stronger results.
Mentor and guide team members to success within the team.
Minimum Qualifications: 
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or information technology
8 + years of software development experience
6 + years of experience with cloud-based software design, building microservices, and automated testing and deployment
6 + years of experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
8 + years of experience in developing Java, REST , REACT , SPRING applications and solutions
8 + years of experience in core Java development / design / architecture
Preferred Qualifications:
Up to date with industry reference of tech trend and solutions.
Thinking leader in building innovation and transformational technology strategies
Enable engineering teams to adapt and promote OpenSource
2 + years of experience with Big Data Tech stack of technologies
2 + years of experience in designing and building solutions using Kafka streams or queues 
2 + years of experience or exposure to Machine Learning and Artificial Engineering would be beneficial.
Master's Degree

That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Senior Manager-Data Science
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
  We are seeking a candidate with specialties in Machine Learning and Data Science to join the Global Decision Science group at American Express. The incumbent will apply advanced analytics and machine learning techniques to develop models to support personal loan underwriting decision making as well as other emerging business opportunities in the company. He/she will interact with cross-functional teams spanning Risk, Marketing and Technology, and be responsible for the end-to-end model development and implementation.
This role will report to Director of Data Science with main responsibilities including:
Design, develop and implement models for emerging opportunities with Machine Learning techniques.
Communicate model algorithms and results to senior leaders and business partners.
R&D on new Machine Learning techniques and their applications in risk management.
  Advanced degree in quantitative field related to machine learning, such as Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition, or Operation Research, is required.
Hands-on experience in machine learning algorithm development or application.
Experience in large data processing and handling.
Familiar with big data platform and its applications, such as Hadoop, Pig, Hive, and Spark.
Master at least one popular programming language (e.g., Python/R, Java, Scala, C++).
Familiarity with credit card and/or installment loan industry is a plus.
Strong communication skills, able to explain complex algorithm and results to business partners in simple terms.
Ability to work in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to work independently yet being a team player.
 
  Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

title: Engineer- Java/Machine Learning
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
From building next-generation apps and microservices in Kotlin to using AI to help protect our customers from fraud, you could be doing transformational work that brings our iconic, global brand into the future. As a part of our tech team, we could work together to bring ground-breaking and diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products and platforms that millions of customers around the world depend on. If you love to work with APIs, contribute to open source, or use the latest technologies, we’ll support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.
 
 Focus:
Contributes to design, development, troubleshooting, debugging, evaluating, modifying, deploying, and documenting software and systems that meet the needs of customer-facing applications, business applications, and/or internal end user applications.
Organizational Context:
Entry-level hire, member of a product engineering or delivery and integration team reporting to a Senior Engineer, Engineering Director or Director Product Delivery & Integration.
How will you make an impact in this role? 
Beginner level ability in software development, such coding assignments.
Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation).
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals.
Participate in code reviews and automated testing.
Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation.
Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments.
Automate deployments in test or production environments.
Automatically scale applications based on demand projections.
Range of Impact/Influence:
Accountable for team completing work you’re leading and work you are doing as agreed upon.
Accountable to team for delivery of quality work.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
2+ years of Software Development experience, with Production support or Ops experience a plus (not critical).
Preferably a BS or MS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other technical discipline.
Strong programming skills in Java, Python, or both.
Hands-on experience with the following technologies: Java or Python, Preferred knowledge on Big Data – Spark/Hive/Hbase, SQL/NoSQL.
Deep code analysis skills with the goal being proactive platform improvement.
Expert Java; fluency with Java 8 streams.  Or, Familiar with one of the popular Machine Learning technologies such as such as ScikitLearn, TensorFlow, Keras, XGBoost/Prophet, NLP, etc.
Knowledgebase with Core Java, Spring, Open source and building RESTful API and services.
Thorough understanding of XML, JSON, Web Service technologies, and data structure fundamentals.
Implementation or working experience of Continuous Integration and Continues Delivery using tools and automation capabilities such as JUnit, Mocking, TestNG, Jenkins, Git, Stash and Jira.
Knowledgebase in SQL or Oracle PL/SQL development and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to perform Root Cause Analysis and determine short term and long-term fixes extremely fast.
Good understanding of Change Management, Problem Management and Incident Management processes a plus.
Willingness to learn new Technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential.
Able to understand and use complex data structures and associated components.
Designs, codes, tests, maintains, and documents applications.
Familiar with GIT.
Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives. 
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
Salary Range: $85,000.00 to $150,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

title: Salesforce Engineer
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
Our Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every single day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So, if you’re passionate about crafting breakthrough applications and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.
  You won’t just keep up; you’ll break new ground.
  At American Express, the Enterprise Platform team was established in 2018 to reimagine the platform solution-delivery model to improve our strategic agility, speed to market, effectiveness of delivery and transparency. Our teams build solutions by harnessing the power of Data, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence to offer powerful selling and re-selling engines to acquire new clients and expand existing client relationships for 20K+ Sales, CRM, and Marketers around the world.
American Express is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified candidates are given considerations for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, age or any other characteristic protected by law.
Responsibilities:
We are looking for engineers with a strong foundation, which you can demonstrate through a combination of formal education, self-learning, own projects or a formal working experience. If you are not willing to learn and write code, then this is not the job for you. Please note that we are open to this role being performed in a fully remote manner.
Develop and implement Salesforce declarative solutions, customizations, applications, extensions and integrations to deliver solutions that impact multiple platforms and products
Perform code reviews, ad-hoc pair programming; contribute to iterative improvement of tools, automation and practices used by team
Develop and improve our CI/CD workflow tools and processes
Perform ongoing refactoring of code, utilize visualization and other techniques to fast-track concepts, and deliver continuous improvement
Promote inner sourcing
Lead and mentor a team of 5-8 junior engineers
Ability to communicate and interact effectively with people of all ages and diverse backgrounds
Ability to analyze business requirements and architect/estimate solutions at various scales
Learn new technologies and drive opportunities for adoption
Coordinate and lead the entire solution cycle through close collaboration with product partners and engineering teams in our ecosystem
Facilitate discussions to identify alternative or different approaches to solve problems, break down barriers and drive resolution of conflicts to ensure productivity of the team
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives.  Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems.  American Express offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source.  And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development.  Find your place in technology of #TeamAmex.
Our ideal candidates demonstrate a strong work ethic, general engineering skills and enjoy learning.
BS degree or higher in computer science or related field
4+ years of experience in software engineering
2+ years of Salesforce Developer Experience
2+ years of experience on an agile development team using a modern programming language (Apex/Java/C#/Scala/Python/Go)
Experience in leading discovery, definition and solutioning of complex requirements for a minimum of 6 cloud engagements
Multiple Salesforce implementations (8+ preferred)
Strong knowledge and prior experience in implementing Sales cloud, Service cloud and SFDX
Experience implementing 1+ customer community and 1+ partner community
Hands on Experience in Apex, Lightning Web Components, JavaScript, JavaScript based frameworks like React/Angular, and UI Frameworks
Strong knowledge of Application, data security and finance related compliance standards
Strong knowledge of microservices, Function as a Service, RESTful API development
Enterprise scale engineering experience (Industry standard build/test/deploy tools, e.g., Git, Bitbucket, SVN, Stack overflow, Jenkins, Maven, XLR, Jacoco, JMeter, Copado, Circle ci)
Salesforce Platform App Builder, Salesforce Admin, Salesforce Developer, Sales Cloud consultant certifications are a must
Able to craft simple, elegant, and comprehensive solutions
Nice to Have Skills:
Salesforce system architect and application architect certifications
Big Data, MuleSoft, Heroku and Tableau
Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.
Non-considerations for sponsorship:
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Data Engineering Director
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
The Risk Decision Technology (RDT) team at American Express is responsible for building software products/capabilities required to manage credit and fraud risk strategies globally. The group handles consumer journeys for Authorizations, Underwriting, and Hardship products for Credit Cards, Loans and Digital Banking. The group operates in Scale Agile methodology (Safe) and partners closely with the Credit and Fraud Teams. Risk strategy, Technology, Servicing and Marketing groups at American Express.
Responsibilities of this job:
This is an exciting opportunity for a technical professional with excellent knowledge of data-oriented capabilities and a track record of successful applications in the Financial Service Industry. As an Engineering Director, you will oversee
The technology strategy and delivery of data inbound and outbound between analytical and operation data store.
You will also be responsible for creating a migration strategy to move the analytical data store from private cloud to public cloud.
Finally, re-design the Audit Logging Utility on the public cloud to flatten the data for rule validation
You and your team will:
Evaluate enterprise offered solutions, conduct extensive proof of concepts and provide data-driven findings to explain functional and non-functional capabilities that address our availability, resiliency, latency, and consistency requirements.
Participates in development of plans and strategies, practices, and standards related to data management processes, data products, data security and programs 
Functions as leading member of an agile team and runs data assets as per the enterprise standards, guidelines, and policies 
Lead design, development, troubleshooting, evaluating, modifying, deployment and documentation of all data components
Debug data components, identify fixes, and validate / remediate design and/or performance defects 
Improve big data table design to follow data placement procedures and re-use of existing databases as appropriate 
Ensure proper data ingestion with zero loss 
Design the different data compute patterns at the time of ingestion
Have strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulation of testing status, problem management, and cross-functional alignment expectations.
Communicate and works collaboratively with business and product teams to support changes and implementation 
Influence vendors to provide solutions and features to meet Amex needs 
Seek opportunities to embrace innovative technologies and maintain a strong rigor in the platform health and improvement
Participate in coding (atleast 50%) and/or hands on technical implementation and debugging
Ability to groom the engineers both in technical and leadership path
Employ technical expertise to help team members overcome technical problems 
Analyze, design, program, debug, and modify software for use in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related environments 
Qualifications: 
  5+ years of experience in leading and delivering in matrixed organizations and interacting with teams across all lines of defense. 
7+ years of experience in hands on engineering in data/distributed eco-system
To be successful in this role you will need to be an expert in java, kafka, spark, big data (Hadoop/Hive). Knowledge in GCP is a plus
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple priorities under pressure. Comfortably deal with fast pace, changing needs, and limited resources.
Ability to see the big picture with attention given to critical details. Ability to balance between technology dictating the path forward and empowering products with speed and predictability.
Strong problem-solving skills: technical aptitude, opiniated on details, understand the internal working of platforms, and drive the vision for the platform.
Experience with variety of non-functional and functional testing practices dealing with massive scale of data, business logic, and low latency distributed engineering on modern cloud. 
Evolve roadmap and strategy, working with product teams, that embraces a holistic view of the business including identifying possible future business opportunities.
Advanced degree in computer science, engineering, or a related technical discipline is preferred
Experience with variety of non-functional and functional testing practices.
Comfortably deals with fast pace, changing needs, and limited resources.
The ability to set a high bar for the team and empower them to achieve better results
A “driver” personality pushing towards clarity and execution while balancing the needs for great collaboration.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulation, and cross-functional alignment expectations.
Ability to share engineering domain expertise with architects and other specialists  
Ability to adapt solutions to meet the broader needs of the portfolio 
Develop and deliver impactful new technologies
Takes part in reviews of own work and leads reviews of colleagues' work 
Has working knowledge of the range of tools used in the planning, analyzing, crafting, building, testing, configuring, and maintaining of assigned application(s) 
Able to participate in assigned team’s software delivery methodology (Agile, Scrum, Agile XP, Test-Driven Development, Waterfall, etc.) 
Understands and has practical experience with infrastructure technologies and components like servers, jvms and networking concepts 
Application of industry practices, processes, and standards 
Identifies several ways to do things differently that will continuously improve the product  
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related field required; advanced degree preferred 
  As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives.  Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems.  American Express offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source.  And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development.  Find your place in technology of #TeamAmex.
Salary Range: $170,000.00 to $255,000.00 annually + bonus + equity (if applicable) + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

title: Product Manager - Enterprise Data Platform
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
The Enterprise Data Platforms (EDP) organization is part of the American Express Enterprise Digital and Data Solutions (EDDS) Group.  EDP manages the Big Data Ecosystem which helps to centralize data across the company with built-in governance and democratization of access to a broad user community. The team is driving the future of our business by building products and platforms that delivers trusted and quality data for decision science processes, big data applications and analytical users. 
We are looking for a Product Manager for our Data Platform Solutions team within the Enterprise Data Platforms organization. This role works closely with Business, Technology, and Infrastructure partners to address user challenges and drive solutions to modernize the enterprise data platform.
 Primary Responsibilities:
Drive the Solution Architecture for developing the strategy and delivery execution of scalable data solutions for enterprise usage (example framework areas are data ingestion, data quality, data lifecycle management, access entitlement)
Understand the current on-prem big data platform landscape, architect the target state architecture, and execute the modernization roadmap to public cloud infrastructure
Define the product vision and strategy for the cloud capabilities in close partnership with technology teams and business stakeholders across the enterprise
Collaborate with product teams, solution team and technology partners to deliver customer centric solutions best tailored to AXP colleague and customer needs
Champion an external perspective in delivering solutions via a deep understanding of the external landscape; inspire and infuse external perspective across workstreams to modernize the platform
Drive large-scale enterprise programs such as Cloud transformation where developing unique customer solutions is required
Develop presentations and communicate with various levels of leadership across the enterprise
Identify needs, opportunities, gaps, and resolve customer challenges with EDP product offerings and enhancements
5+ years of product owner experience in driving agile development processes to deliver new product asks
Strong understanding of products and services in GCP platform, cloud technology, streaming solutions, and third-party cloud product
Knowledge of big data platform architecture, data management and newer developments in the industry
Highly organized and self-motivated individual who can combine problem-resolution, and critical thinking to apply a business lens to design customer-obsessed solutions
Inherent customer focus with an ability to interact with leaders at all levels of the organization
Possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, excellent communication & collaboration skills; ability to build relationships, influence decisions, and inspire cross-functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Confidence in decision-making in complex & ambiguous situations; comfortable troubleshooting and aligning conflicting interests
Degree in STEM fields with work experience in information management, strategy, or the payments business
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
 Salary Range: $110,000.00 to $190,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Finance Technologies
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
The Finance Technology group at American Express is entering into a new phase of technology transformation driven by opportunities to simplify processes, deepen business intelligence, analytics and reporting, and raise operational efficiency. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative products and services at a rapid pace, with hands on experience and strategic thinking, in areas of data management and analytics, cloud computing, and modern software engineering, join our leadership team to be part of our transformation journey
I’m the principal engineer looking after finance technologies, and I’m looking for a passionate senior engineering manager to join my team. I have a wide range of scope, and I'm looking for someone with a strong knowledge of pipelines, CICD and Kotlin to join the team and drive change for my peers by demonstrating to their team's awesome engineering.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
Qualifications:
4-10 years of software development experience in a professional environment and/or comparable experience such as:
Familiar with Agile or other rapid application development methods
Experience with design and coding across one or more platforms and languages as appropriate
Hands-on expertise with application design, software development and automated testing
Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
Confirmed experience with object-oriented design and coding with variety of languages
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related experience required; advanced degree preferred
Expert knowledge on Informatica Designer, Workflow Manager and Workflow Monitor.
Awareness on Dimensional modelling concepts.
Strong knowledge on Oracle SQL, ETL performance tuning and unix scripting.
Ability to effectively collaborate with Finance SMEs and partners of all levels to understand their business processes and take overall ownership of Analysis, Design, Estimation and Delivery of technical solutions for Finance business requirements and roadmaps.
Software Development:
Ability in software development, such coding assignments
Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation)
Participate in code reviews and automated testing
Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation
Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments
Automate deployments in test or production environments
Automatically scale applications based on demand projections
Leadership:
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals
Influence team members with creative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking
 Range of Impact/Influence:
Accountable for team completing work you’re leading and work you are doing as agreed upon
Accountable to team for delivery of quality work
Salary Range: $110,000.00 to $190,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

title: Manager-Data Science
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path. Find your place in risk and analytics on #TeamAmex.
How will you make an impact in this role?
The Model Risk Management Group (MRMG) is responsible for oversight of model risk and governance over machine learning usage enterprise wide. The role will be primarily responsible for the review of Finance/ Treasury/ Anti-Money Laundering and Climate Risk models. The responsibilities of the individual are also to ensure that there is an elevation of modeling as well as fulfilling regulatory requirements for model risk management (SR 11-7). This is a highly competitive role and one that ensures the individual achieves maximum potential intellectually as well as for the company.
This role will report to a director in MRMG. The specific responsibilities include:
- Oversee Finance/ Treasury/ Anti-Money Laundering and Climate Risk models which include evaluating conceptual soundness, data quality, performance validation, and on-going monitoring
- Document detailed model review reports and prepare for regulatory and internal audit reviews
- Communicate model review results to business partners, senior leaders, and regulators
- Evaluate machine learning algorithms and their application on models
- Enhance governance framework to accommodate the evolving modeling techniques, model development, as well as model risk management
Qualifications
- Advanced degree in quantitative fields
- Hands-on modeling experience is preferred
- The qualified candidate should have a good understanding of machine learning algorithms (e.g., gradient boosting machine, XGBoost, neural network), artificial intelligence, deep learning as well as classic statistical modeling techniques and assumptions.
- Experience in large data processing and handling is a plus—familiarity with big data platforms and applications, such as Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Spark, AWS.
- Must be skilled in coding using SAS and/or Python/R; additionally, Java, Scala, and C++ a plus
- Strong communication and written skills
- Flexibility and adaptability to work within tight deadlines and changing priorities
Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.

Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
Enterprise Data Governance & Platforms (EDGP) is part of the larger Enterprise Digital and Data Solutions (EDDS) organization. EDGP improves the customer experience and drives business growth through robust enterprise-wide data policies and governance and enabling a data-driven culture, while developing digital and data platforms that provide insightful customer relationships and allow users to leverage enterprise-wide data capabilities.
Seeking a Sr. Manager – Digital Product Operations for the Customer Enablement team within the Enterprise Data Platform organization.  You will build relationships and work across multiple teams and organizations to work with customers and key stakeholders to provide a terrific Lumi customer enablement experience across the major enterprise data platforms.  We are committed to our diverse workforce goals ensuring equal opportunities for all our team members. You will be encouraged to devote time and effort to grow your knowledge and skillset.
What would your responsibilities be in this role? You will . . .
Collaborate with customers and key stakeholders to deliver Lumi capabilities that improve the overall experience for our big data customers and teams
Actively drive communication and sharing sessions with prospective Lumi customers to create a forum that fosters collaboration and proactively identifies the needs of our partners
Lead Lumi customer advisory forums which provide insight into the Lumi program and capabilities
Drive communication for EDP leadership and to customers (Lumi value stories, presentations, etc.)
Partner with customer success team to enhance Lumi training opportunities for customers
Support Lumi platform enhancements by leveraging feedback from customers and working across the solutions management and product teams to drive positive results
Support data governance and compliance to strengthen Platform Governance to meet Audit and Enterprise Data policy requirements
Effectively implement use cases with cooperative engagement from business partners and technical leaders
Conduct meetings that encourage teamwork while driving effective corrective actions and prioritizing necessary infrastructure process enhancements to improve performance and availability
Demonstrate a sense of urgency and enthusiasm in developing elite Enterprise Data Platform services
Utilize and define operational standards, requirements, and associated documentation – ensure all processes are clear and auditable
  Have you already been working in a data platform environment with customer and analytical experience?  Then this opportunity should be perfect, and you are encouraged to apply.
5+ years of experience in Product Operations Management with proven track record in carrying out discovery and analysis to support the creation of our Product Vision, Strategy and Framework
Experience handling customer interactions and executive reporting
Proven track record managing large, complex features or products with multiple partners
Ambitious with strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to present strategies to senior leaders and drive decision-making
Data Driven:  Responsible for gathering and using data and analytics to deliver great customer experiences
Customer First:  Obsess over customer needs - identify opportunities and gaps, work to address those needs
Measure and Learn:  Maintain metrics and key performance indicators to manage the product
Partner and Collaborate:  Work closely with engineering, data, analytics, and product management teams to deliver results
Shows a genuine personal dedication to successfully completing all projects with an ability to learn rapidly and adapt quickly to changing situations
Confirmed history influencing and getting results for enterprise-level projects
Aptitude to develop and maintain strong working relationships with both internal and external partners
Inspires confidence and the ability to handle ambiguity, multiple tasks, shifting priorities and set schedule to meet deliverables (works with a positive attitude, be flexible, and prioritize tasks)
Strategic thinker, who can combine technical skills with overall business strategy to creatively resolve complex problems in a dynamic environment
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a member of a team
Proficient using PowerPoint, Excel, Jira, and MS Word
Bachelor in Computer Science/Management Information Systems or equivalent experience preferred
Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Enterprise Data Governance & Platforms (EDGP) is part of the larger Enterprise Digital and Data Solutions (EDDS) organization.  EDGP improves the customer experience and drives business growth through robust enterprise-wide data policies and governance and enabling a data-driven culture, while developing digital and data platforms that provide insightful customer relationships and allow users to leverage enterprise-wide data capabilities.
Seeking a Manager – Digital Product Operations for the Customer Enablement team within the Enterprise Data Platform organization. We are committed to our diverse workforce goals ensuring equal opportunities for all our team members. You will be encouraged to devote time and effort to grow your knowledge and skillset.

title: Manager-Enterprise Data Strategy
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
The Manager will be part of the Enterprise Data Strategy team under Credit & Fraud Risk (CFR) which is dedicated to helping American Express leverage partnerships and external data as key strategic assets.
Enterprise Data Strategy team is responsible for driving acquisition, underwriting and customer management data strategies for credit & fraud risk decisioning models and strategies. The incumbent will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate with colleagues across the enterprise to bring innovation into CFR and bring American Express to the forefront of the data economy.
Responsibilities include:
Develop innovative and impactful data driven insights and analytics through our strategic partnerships to drive business growth and credit & fraud risk management excellence
Closely partner with colleagues across CFR Data Strategy, Product Owners, Compliance, CFR Risk Strategy, CFR Fraud Strategy and Decisions Science to successfully design, implement, monitor, and govern strategies related to external data
Identify new data opportunities and enhance existing data exchange processes
Analyze existing and new data sources to uncover opportunities that will optimize our data solutions & purchases and address business needs
Collaborate with external strategic partners to influence data product development
Become a subject matter expert on CFR’s data asset inventory
Own a portfolio of strategic data partners and manage all aspects of relationship including data quality and relationship monitoring, product performance, data testing/use cases and negotiations
Develop metrics to deliver strong controls and insights
Lead complex global projects which involve multiple internal and external partners
Influence, lead and communicate across a broad range of audiences, including internal and external senior leadershi
MInimum Qualifications:
Demonstrated ability to work independently and across a matrixed organization to deliver solutions at top speed
Ability to manage and lead large scale projects with multiple cross functional partners
Good communication and influencing skills with an ability to translate data and analytics into business insights and recommendations, conceptualize and sell ideas
Strong technical skills to perform data evaluation, analytics, and matrices tracking/reporting
Knowledge of Python, SQL, Spark, SAS, and familiar with big data and cloud environments
At least 5 years of experience in a financial services organization in data or strategy function
Knowledge of Credit Risk and or Fraud Risk standards, practices, or external Credit or Fraud Risk data sources preferred
Master's Degree or higher required, concentration in a quantitative field preferred
Ability to multitask, prioritize and work under a fluid environment
Adaptable interpersonal skills, high energy, and a proven team-first mentality
Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.

Enterprise Data Governance & Platforms (EDGP) is part of the larger Enterprise Digital and Data Solutions (EDDS) organization. EDGP improves the customer experience and drives business growth through robust enterprise-wide data policies and governance and enabling a data-driven culture, while developing digital and data platforms that provide insightful customer relationships and allow users to leverage enterprise-wide data capabilities.
  Develop and drive Open Banking strategy for American Express aligning it to customer value, product, and business goals 
Identify and effectively analyze new opportunities for American Express, making recommendations to relevant decision makers and cross-functional stakeholders 
Lead strategic and complex negotiations with Open Banking partnerships to completion, engaging cross-functional teams and ensuring alignment across teams on deal terms 
Manage the relationship with regional or global stakeholders including defining the overall strategy and influencing outcomes relating to Open Banking
Work in complex, cross functional teams with strong influence, communication, and ability to incorporate the contributions, objectives and constraints into strategic framework, partnerships, and experience designs 
Support with end-to-end deployment of winning digital solutions in markets including prioritization internally 
Monitor external landscape, regulatory, industry and competitive environment regarding Open Banking and Open Finance developments.
Maintain a full understanding of relevant compliance and regulatory issues across Amex’s global markets for all Open Data policy initiatives.
Qualifications:
  Expertise in Open Banking, data and / or financial services 
5+ years of experience in business development, partnerships, strategic project management, product management or similar roles at a technology company or financial services company 
Strong product instincts and ability to identify commercial opportunities. Ability to influence decisions and drive alignment across cross-functional teams 
Broad and deep experience executing industry-wide partnership strategies to build innovative experiences and go to market models 
Strong negotiation skills and ability to independently drive complex negotiations to completion 
Strong verbal and written communication skills – including the ability to speak to different constituencies such as business development, product, engineering, legal internally and externally 
Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty and ambiguity 
Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

title: Senior Analyst-Risk Management
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
Authorization Modernization Program (AMP) is a high priority strategic initiative aimed at uplifting the authorization platform (CAS), which performs critical tasks to support business processes across multiple touch points in the customer lifecycle, for e.g. deciding approval or decline of a transaction based on a business logic, applying payment information, computing key data elements (exposure, delinquency, risk scores, etc.), triggering risk strategies and cascading credit risk related information to other critical systems like RAVEN (for customer communication), WCC (for credit servicing), MYCA (customer self service), etc..
The position of Senior Analyst, US Commercial AMP Servicing is within the Global Commercial Customer Management team, part of the Commercial Credit Risk organization. The position will report into the Manager, US AMP Servicing and will work closely with business partners across the organization (GSG, Compliance, GCO, Capabilities, CFR peers and leaders). The successful candidate will be responsible for designing POA processes across credit digital and case management functions globally, and closely collaborating with various GSG teams to apply process synergies. This role will also provide the incumbent ample opportunities to lead and influence partners within and outside CFR.
The key responsibilities are:
Lead transformation of the next gen authorization / customer management capability by defining requirements for key functions of credit concern identification and subsequent servicing (trigger, communication, treatment) globally (including Global Consumer and Small Business Services).
Collaborate with SMEs from these functional areas to understand end to end process and leverage understanding to drive scope alignment, discovery, design and subsequent implementation.
Conceptualize and deliver robust and scalable capability, and support functions within it, by leveraging platform uplift synergies across CFR and GSG.
Deepen understanding of relevant functions and data elements to map out requirements for relevant customer journeys.
Use analytics to identify key areas to simplify or prioritize for uplift.
Influence various stakeholders to seek alignment on various decision points.
Qualifications
Interest in commercial credit risk
Experience in analyzing structured/unstructured data using SQL, SAS, or Python
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially MS Excel and PowerPoint
Attention to detail and comfortable working with large data sets
Capability of translating data-driven insights into actionable results
Ability to drive change, influence without authority and deliver results
Desire to build business cases and manage projects
Logical, consultative, and adaptive to change
Strategic thinking, ability to work independently and prioritize tasks
Positive energy, collaboration and excellent communication skills are a must
Undergraduate degree required
Candidates with graduate degrees or related experience will be considered for Senior Analyst roles.
Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.

Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
  This position works closely with Enterprise Digital & Analytics Product teams to craft, develop and support critical components and platforms for a majority of American Express products and services, that drive current and prospective customer acquisition and loyalty via multitude of channels.  We are looking for a dynamic, innovative, action-and-results oriented leader to lead this fast-evolving eco system.

The Ideal candidate is required to be accomplished in the development and deployment of complex software solutions with a strong focus on Cloud based engineering, and various Java technologies including Spring, API design and user experience. The candidate should be able to come up with innovative solutions, have a pragmatic approach to application architecture, and be excited to work on a varied tech stack. You will be expected to have a deep understanding of the functional platforms; and plan, lead, and implement the tech advancement roadmap. You are required to have a futuristic approach, along with the ability to question status quo and technologically advance the platforms.

This is an opportunity to work in a fast-paced, Scaled Agile environment and work with a team of engineers, product owners and several technology partners. You should be familiar with modern software development methodologies and be able to dive deep and rapidly iterate on ideas despite ambiguity.
  Responsibilities:
Bring a strong technical foundation; able to engage the team on coding practices, architecture, design, get under the hood of complex integrated architectures, coding systems, and interface design
Collaborate successfully with product owners, designers, and a broad set of internal Technical partners (across multiple internal groups)
Ensure product releases are high quality, deliver excellent user experiences, perform seamlessly at scale, and comply with regulatory requirements.
Partner with peers in technologies to find opportunities for code sharing, common services, joint development, etc.
Keep up with the latest industry research and emerging technologies to ensure we are appropriately leveraging new techniques and capabilities.
Demonstrate accountability while leading people with passion, enthusiasm, loyalty, and integrity. Own and lead HR processes such as performance reviews, talent development, etc.
Flawless interpersonal skills and ability to partner with executive leadership to push Technical solutions forward.
Recruit top talent with technical skills, growth potential, design sensibility, and emotional intelligence.
Lead teams in iterative product development using lean principles.
Build and lead a successful, self-managing team of Software Engineers.
Passion, energy, personal accountability, and a desire to lead others to excellence.
Build and leverage strong relationships with business and Technology partners.
Drive strategic change in tools and process.
Deep appreciation for the importance of elegant solutions to Technical challenges.
Consistently question assumptions, challenge the status quo, and strive for improvement.
Never settle for being “good enough.”
  As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives.  Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems.  American Express offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source.  And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development.  Find your place in technology of #TeamAmex.
  Minimum Qualifications:
Extensive background in Software Product Engineering and Computer Science.
10+ years of  experience building and shipping large scale software products.
Strong Experience in Agile, Agile development, code review, CSS, Eclipse, HTML, Java, Javascript, Angular, Spring framework, Redis, Relational database, Cloud computing, UNIX and Web Services.
Moderate or higher skill in SOA, Restful, Asynchronous and Microservices technologies for large scale environments.
Strong understanding and experience in CICD and DevOps
In depth knowledge of Customer Marketing technology ecosystem and related programs is required
Knowledge of American Express Marketing & Data platforms a plus
The ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely to non-technical individuals
Excellent verbal and written communications skills required, with ability to create and deliver effective presentations to executive leadership and technical architects across the organization is a plus.
Hands on experience with technology planning and road mapping
Experience leading problem analysis and resolution
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Information Systems degree or equivalent work experience; Advanced Degree preferred
  Technology Core Competencies
Adaptive Communication
Agile Practices
Industry and Company Knowledge
Organizational Change Management
Technical Competence
Technology Industry Trends
  Game Changers:
Adaptability
Collaboration & Teamwork
Continuous Improvement
Courage
Curiosity
Ingenuity
Servant Leadership
Salary Range: $170,000.00 to $255,000.00 annually + bonus + equity (if applicable) + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
